text: hi my name is peter dimarzo i'm the
mizuho financial group professor of
finance at the stanford graduate school
of business i'm also currently our
senior associate dean for the gsb in
charge of executive education and online
programs in my research i focus on how
firms fund themselves the types of
securities that they issue and how they
market those securities
also the types of information
the type of information that firms
disclose to markets and when they choose
to disclose that information
so broad aspects of corporate finance
more generally in looking at
funding decisions that firms make
so there are a number of really exciting
questions in this area currently in the
market in the wake of the financial
crisis for example
one of the big outstanding questions is
understanding the optimal funding
structure for banks
one of the reasons the financial crisis
was as severe as it is is because banks
use primarily debt financing and so when
their profits drop
many of the banks find themselves
underwater and unable to continue
without government support
and so one of the main topics of my
research now is looking at optimal
regulation of bank capital in particular
you know should they use as much debt
funding as they do
or should we have requirements for for
banks to reduce leverage uh making the
financial system much less fragile going
forward
i received my phd in economics here at
stanford university and after that went
to teach at the kellogg graduate school
of management and then the haas school
of business at uc berkeley
i've also had the opportunity to engage
in many different exec ed programs
as well as numerous consulting
arrangements with firms here in silicon
valley
being here at stanford is a wonderful
privilege
i'm delighted with the colleagues
first-rate scholars both here in the
business school but really across the
entire campus and the opportunity to
work with people from so many different
disciplines is unparalleled
second is really the outstanding quality
of our students
teaching at the gsb
is a real pleasure every time i walk
into the classroom i'm always the one
learning something in addition to the
students i hope
when i think about innovation i really
think about individuals creating value
that is identifying new opportunities
ways to take resources and deploy them
in new ways but ultimately create value
both for themselves for their firms for
their customers and that's really i
think the heart of innovation
